list_definition.definition: a covered passage or area usually with shops, stalls etc

list_ex_of_english: There were about 500 responses from operators of seaside arcades or family entertainment centres.
None, as it is not an offence to allow young people to gamble in amusement arcades.
Amusement arcades are another source of child exploitation.
The rooms - curious, quaint, old, barrack chambers - were well lighted, decorated with flags, flowers, and fire-arms; bowers and pleasant arcades were improvised in the open.
They did not want more "palaces of culture"—a euphemism for slot machine arcades.
I do not consider it acceptable for such machines to be in amusement arcades at this time.
We keep the law on amusement arcades under review.
Such a ban would also have a dramatic impact on the tangential businesses that support amusement arcades, such as electricians and plumbers.
